detachmentRule.name: get stuck in
detachmentRule.lore: Once an Ork gets stuck into hand-to-hand combat, they quickly overwhelm their enemies through sheer ferocity
detachmentRule.description: Melee weapons equipped by ORKS models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.

enhacements.name: Follow Me Ladz
enhacements.lore: Always found at the forefront of an assault, this Ork likes to be the first into the fray.
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, add 2'' to the Move characteristic of models in that unit.

enhacements.name: Headwoppa’s Killchoppa
enhacements.lore: Grand Warboss Headwoppa and his tribe were last seen charging headlong into a horde of Khornate daemons, but legend speaks of a blood-slick choppa that still turns up occasionally. Though this weapon looks normal, a dark voice is said to growl in the mind of its wielder, driving them on to ever greater excesses of violence.
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. Melee weapons equipped by the bearer that do not have the [EXTRA ATTACKS] ability have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

enhacements.name: Kunnin’ but Brutal
enhacements.lore: Feigning weakness, this greenskin allows his foes to close in before delivering a brutal flurry of attacks.
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, that unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

enhacements.name: Supa-cybork Body
enhacements.lore: The original owner of this one-of-a-kind endoskeleton became the envy of every Warboss around, and was soon gutted and stripped for parts by a stronger rival. The Supa-Cybork Body has been retransplanted several times since then, filling its new owner with confidence, resilience and a belated hope that the Painboyz gave it a quick clean before shoving it back in place…
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. The bearer has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

stratagems.name: careen!
stratagems.lore: If their vehicle is on its last legs, any Ork worth their steering wheel will aim its blazing remains into the nearest cluster of enemies. The ensuing explosions never fail to raise a rousing cheer from nearby Ork onlookers.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after an ORKS VEHICLE unit from your army with the Deadly Demise ability is destroyed.
stratagems.target: That destroyed ORKS VEHICLE unit, if you roll a 6 for its Deadly Demise ability. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal or Fall Back move before its Deadly Demise ability is resolved, and before any embarked units perform an Emergency Disembarkation. When making this move, your unit can move over enemy units (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) as if they were not there.

stratagems.name: orks is never beaten
stratagems.lore: So resilient is Ork physiology – and so slow are Orks on the uptake – that even killing wounds can take a while to register.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One ORKS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

stratagems.name: unbridled carnage
stratagems.lore: When Orks get stuck into the foe, the carnage is wonderful to behold, at least for other Orks.
stratagems.target: One ORKS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an ORKS model in your unit makes a melee attack, an unmodified hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

stratagems.name: 'ard as nails'
stratagems.lore: Even the lowliest Ork Boy can take a tremendous amount of punishment before being slain.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One ORKS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot select a VEHICLE or GRETCHIN unit for this Stratagem.

stratagems.name: mob rule
stratagems.lore: The more Orks that gather in one place the more the Waaagh! energy flows, and the more fearless they all become.
stratagems.target: One MOB unit from your army that contains 10 or more models and is not Below Half-strength.
stratagems.effect: Until the start of your next Command phase, while a friendly ORKS INFANTRY unit is within 6'' of that MOB unit, that ORKS INFANTRY unit can still be selected as the target of your Stratagems even if it is Battle-shocked.’

stratagems.name: ere we go
stratagems.lore: Ever cunning and duplicitous, broods of the faithful often vanish back into tunnels and vents after their initial strike, ready to regroup and attack again elsewhere.
stratagems.target: One ORKS INFANTRY unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, add 2 to Advance and Charge rolls made for your unit.
